Tasks.Task Description: Identify the business needs for using Azure ExpressRoute, including required bandwidth, latency, and redundancy for applications.
Create a detailed design of the network architecture, including the placement of ExpressRoute circuits, peering locations, and integration with existing on-premises networks.
Choose a connectivity provider that supports Azure ExpressRoute and can meet the required Service Level Agreement (SLA) for performance.
Request the LOA from Microsoft to authorize the connectivity provider to provision the connection for ExpressRoute.
Create and configure the required ExpressRoute circuits in the Azure portal or using Azure CLI/PowerShell, ensuring redundancy across multiple locations.
Submit the LOA to the selected connectivity provider to initiate the provisioning of the physical connection.
Set up necessary peering configurations, including defining VLANs, BGP peering, and route filters according to the design specifications.
Enable security measures such as encryption (e.g., MACsec) on the ExpressRoute circuits and configure cryptographic keys and policies.
Configure BGP sessions between on-premises routers and Azure ExpressRoute circuits, ensuring proper route advertisement and acceptance policies.
Conduct thorough testing of the connectivity, including failover scenarios, throughput tests, and latency measurements to validate the setup.
Establish redundant circuits and connections to ensure high availability and verify that failover mechanisms are functioning correctly.
Apply security best practices such as Network Security Groups (NSGs) and Azure DDoS Protection to secure the network traffic.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor and Network Watcher, configuring alerts for circuit status and performance metrics.
Document the network architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Conduct training sessions for the operations team.
Ensure the setup meets regulatory compliance requirements and implement regular auditing procedures to verify compliance.
Use Azure Monitor and Network Watcher to continuously monitor the health and status of ExpressRoute circuits. Identify and investigate any anomalies or potential issues.
Check the stability of BGP sessions. Monitor for route flaps or unexpected changes in route advertisements that could impact ExpressRoute connectivity.
Analyze ExpressRoute circuit performance data to ensure operations within expected parameters. Investigate and address any performance deviations.
Perform failover tests to verify that redundant paths, including VPN backups, function correctly and can take over in case of primary ExpressRoute path failures.
Conduct audits of ExpressRoute configurations to ensure alignment with documented architecture and best practices for the service.
Review and update security policies, Network Security Groups (NSGs), and access controls to adapt to changes in the ExpressRoute network or security landscape.
Keep ExpressRoute service documentation up-to-date, including operational procedures, configuration details, and troubleshooting guides.

Regularly back up configurations of on-premises routers, firewalls, and other critical network devices connected to ExpressRoute. Ensure secure and accessible storage of backups for potential restoration.
Collect and analyze user feedback regarding ExpressRoute performance and reliability. Implement continuous improvements based on this feedback.
